description.narrative: By 2020 local support mechanism exists to provide child-friendly services to survivors or witnesses of violence, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 families' resilience and coping mechanisms are strengthened and parents know about the importance of the early years

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF FINANCES AND REAR OF MINISTRY OF INTERIOR OF BELARUS

mailing-address.narrative: 22A Krasnoarmejskaya Street 220030 Minsk Republic of Belarus

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 local support mechanism exists to provide child-friendly services to survivors or witnesses of violence

description.narrative: Through a partnership with MOI and the Investigative Committee, law enforcement practices related to cybercrime investigation were harmonized with international standards and protection of at-risk children were improved through the introduction of an online interactive tool and referral mechanism. At the same time, the CO worked closely with the MoE to promote safe and enabling environment in Belarusian schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: SEES model initiated in at least 3 schools & initial practice documented

target.value: 2020:SEES model is tested at least in 5 schools with accompanying information outreach on prevention of peer violence, including on Internet

actual.value: 2019:Due to changes in legislation, implementation of the model will be launched in 2020/21 academic year. From January 2020 the model will be tested in 2 schools of Minsk city. In 2019 conditions for implementation were created: a group of mentors (20 people) was formed and trained, a manual on SEES mod
